intro: Maihueniopsis rahmeri, commonly known as the Andean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold climates. It has narrow, silvery leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Maihueniopsis rahmeri is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
